alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 11:56AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bullock and southeastern Macon Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1156 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Guerryton, or 8 miles northeast of Union Springs, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Guerryton, Creek Stand and Warriorstand. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
